fi.grimripper.loww.movement

Interface MoveModeListener


  • public interface MoveModeListener
    A listener interface to observe changes in a mobile object's collection of movement modes. The listener receives notifications when movement modes are added and removed, or enabled or disabled, or when the active movement mode changes. In addition, the listener is notified before a movement mode is added, and can prevent that mode from being added.
    Author:
    Marko Tuominen
    See Also:
    MobileObject, MovementMode

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activeModeChanged(MobileObject mobile, MovementMode deactivated, MovementMode activated)
      Notified when the active movement mode changes.
      boolean canAddMovementMode(MobileObject mobile, MovementMode mode)
      Determines whether or not a movement mode can be added.
      void movementModeAdded(MobileObject mobile, MovementMode mode)
      Notified when a new movement mode is added to the mobile object.
      void movementModeRemoved(MobileObject mobile, MovementMode mode)
      Notified when a movement mode is removed from the mobile object.

    • Method Detail

      • canAddMovementMode

        boolean canAddMovementMode(MobileObject mobile,
                         MovementMode mode)
        Determines whether or not a movement mode can be added. If any listener returns false, then the movement mode can't be given to the mobile object. The movement mode shouldn't be modified, because this method is used only to test if it's possible to add the movement mode. There's also no guarantee that all listeners will be called, because only one false is needed to prevent the movement mode from being added.
        Parameters:
        mobile - the mobile object about to receive a new movement mode
        mode - the mobile object's would-be new movement mode
        Returns:
        true to allow adding the mode

      • movementModeAdded

        void movementModeAdded(MobileObject mobile,
                     MovementMode mode)
        Notified when a new movement mode is added to the mobile object. Usually the new addition will become the active mode, since it has the highest priority. Unless it's already disabled, there's also a notification for activeModeChanged. This event shouldn't be used to disable the movement mode that was just added. Mobile object doesn't allow disabling the new mode between add event and activation event.
        Parameters:
        mobile - this mobile object received a new movement mode
        mode - the mobile object's new movement mode
        See Also:
        activeModeChanged(MobileObject, MovementMode, MovementMode)

      • movementModeRemoved

        void movementModeRemoved(MobileObject mobile,
                       MovementMode mode)
        Notified when a movement mode is removed from the mobile object. In case the removed mode was active, there'll also be a notification for activeModeChanged.
        Parameters:
        mobile - this mobile object lost one of its movement modes
        mode - the removed movement mode
        See Also:
        activeModeChanged(MobileObject, MovementMode, MovementMode)

      • activeModeChanged

        void activeModeChanged(MobileObject mobile,
                     MovementMode deactivated,
                     MovementMode activated)
        Notified when the active movement mode changes. Change of active mode will normally be triggered by adding, removing, disabling or enabling movement modes.
        Parameters:
        mobile - this mobile object's active movement mode changed
        deactivated - the formerly active movement mode (null if the mobile object didn't have an active movement mode before)
        activated - the newly active movement mode (null if the mobile object doesn't have an active movement mode anymore)
